website_summaries.verdict: Reliable performance, trusted brand, and excellent craftsmanship – everything you need in tennis balls at a reasonable price.
pros: Well-made balls by a top brand in tennis gear
Players, including some trainers, brag about their bounce, thanks in part to the real rubber construction
cons: Rare complaints of flat balls upon delivery or after several gamesand of a strange odor when they are new that may fade over time

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars from a 6 month old puppy
customer_reviews.text: durable and hours of entertainment. mama and puppy approved. probably good for tennis too
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: The best feeling in the world is cracking open a fresh ...
customer_reviews.text: The best feeling in the world is cracking open a fresh can of tennis balls. We use these for my dog. She is a ball whore
customer_reviews.author: Phillis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my medium sized dog who is a strong chewer and can demolish a tennis ball in about 30 minutes. These tennis balls are much less expensive than tennis balls sold as a dog toy and last MUCH longer. I do not play tennis, but if I did I would imagine these would also be long lasting for tennis play or practice.
customer_reviews.author: LeonaBelle

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Tennis Balls
customer_reviews.text: I do not use these tennis balls for playing tennis, as I am not a tennis player. I purchased them for other games and activities. They arrived quickly, in re-usable storage container, are stable enough for rough n tumble handling. It was necessary to "air" them out before use, as residual manufacturing odor was present, but it passed. Their vivid color makes them easy to re-find, and they are holding up well. High Quality product for little cost.
customer_reviews.author: Indie Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Very durable as a pet ball
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my aggressive chewer dog. I have had them for 5 months and they still look new. These are my dogs favorite, so he hasn’t tried to chew the fuzz off yet. He does hold them in his mouth and bite down on them a lot and they are still in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D

customer_reviews.title: Horrible odor
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, but the moment these tennis balls came out of the can everyone in my house complained about the odor. I tried to give it some time but the odor is so bad they are in the outdoor garbage can. In an outdoor setting things might be different but I would warn not to transport them in your car or tennis bag unless they are in the sealed can. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Polo47

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are less than $2 at walmart. Otherwise solid balls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't use as dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: If you planned on getting these tennis balls to use in your dryer to fluff up your clothes (like some life hack or homemaker blog had suggested) don't use these. After 2 minutes of being in my dryer on a low heat setting, you could smell something burning throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: hbhalala

customer_reviews.title: Toby knows
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them. He says they're the absolute best!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie rugamer

customer_reviews.title: Dog approved.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I bought these for my dog, not tennis, he loves them. His sister does strip off the felt so they look awful. Repeated hits on a wall does break them but that is abuse so not the product. They fit the ball chucker great and bounce like the devil. Your dog will probably paw up on these too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: They pass the Pippi test!
customer_reviews.text: I got these balls for my friend Pippi. She's half Pit, half Border Collie, and has no idea of her own power! Finally, a ball that has lasted since yesterday and still feels sturdy! Others I got her lasted for about 3 minutes!!! If you have a big dog that loves to catch and fetch, try these. If these keep holding up, I will order them again!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Alyce McClain

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these tennis balls and the only time we give him a new one is when the fuzz on the ball starts to get ugly but it takes months for that to happen. Good bounce, he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: McKinzie Selvidge

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the 12 can number.
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered as described. The price is just below the Costco case, but pay attention to the fact that Costco sells 20 cans for $45 and these are 12 cans for $43.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy & durable.
customer_reviews.text: I used these tennis balls as ball heels for my medical walker. And they worked perfectly. Might not be the products intended purpose, but none the less they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Maka L. Swifteagle

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs
customer_reviews.text: These are the only tennis balls that hold up to my border collie puppie's playing. Much more durable and well made than pet tennis balls! I suspect they work well on the tennis court too!
customer_reviews.author: PatradTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not high altitude balls.
customer_reviews.text: Fast and well packaged shipping but the tennis balls were not high altitude which was the whole reason I bought them. They are still extra duty so they are still usable but I live in Colorado and I have seen complaints from opponents when you don't use high altitude balls.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These will last a very, very long time. They may seem a bit pricey if you think you're going to be discarding them every match like you see on TV, but in reality just one ball will last for months.
customer_reviews.author: chi

customer_reviews.title: Tennis balls for walker
customer_reviews.text: These tennis balls were purchased to use on the back of my walker after I found the plastic skis were scratching my new wood floors. Wanted tennis balls that were smooth but tough when pushed on wood or cement. Cut and attached them today. Looks as if I picked out the best grade.
customer_reviews.author: Nelda H

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Used on my friends walker. Given what they were used for they lasted a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Bouncy

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them

customer_reviews.text: Not sure how well these last when being used for actual tennis, but my dog destroyed them in a few minutes. Lol, you live and learn.

customer_reviews.title: Posting for my 100# Pitweiler mix. Tennis ball are ...
customer_reviews.text: Posting for my 100# Pitweiler mix. Tennis ball are his fave toy and you shoulda seen the look on his face when these arrived. He thought he hit the lottery jackpot. One downside; they don't last long since his big, powerful mouth can crack these baby's open within a day.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Quality of material is not long lasting. Bounce etc is good

customer_reviews.title: Good Product

customer_reviews.title: Great Tennis Balls!
customer_reviews.text: As an avid tennis player, I’ve used these tennis balls in the past and continue to enjoy their quality. They feel sturdy in my hand, well made and are great to play with. I play outside, so I appreciate their durability. I would purchase these again in the future. Great price for a few extra balls!

customer_reviews.text: I have a really powerful nose, so maybe it's just me, but I can smell these tennis balls from wherever they are in the room. Toxic, awful odor - would not recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Do now buy in low altitudes.
customer_reviews.text: Im sure its a good ball for high altitudes like its designed for. I live in the South and want to stress that this isnt a good ball for low altitudes. Didnt realize there would be so much difference. My mistake for sure. I just dont want others to make the same.

customer_reviews.title: After a little research, I discovered that High Altitude ...
customer_reviews.text: After a little research, I discovered that High Altitude Tennis Balls have less pressure and are 6% bigger than standard tennis balls. I live at over 6,000 feet and find that the high altitude balls compensate for the added speed and bounce the we experience up here with standard balls.

customer_reviews.title: Okay.  Standard tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: Tennis balls. Bouncy, fuzzy, green. What more can I say.

customer_reviews.title: Fluff and fold

customer_reviews.title: High Altitude Tennis Balls
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for use at altitude (almost 10,000 feet), still plenty of bounce. Good value and easily hold up to har-tru. Now if they could only package oxygen along with them.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant buying these in bulk since some reviewers say they received some that are flat. I went ahead and purchased a lot and every ball was pressurized and the packages were sealed with full pressure. Very good bounce and the product quality meets the price by far.

customer_reviews.title: For the dog!
customer_reviews.text: These were the cheapest (price-wise!) tennis balls I could find for my dog. Bought a bunch of them for my GSD who has to play fetch on a daily basis or she literally won't be able to sleep at night! She loves these balls and they are working great so far. She is known for destroying a tennis ball - usually breaking it in 2 - within minutes of getting it. Loves chewing and slobbering all over them. But these hold up! She's yet to break any of them so far and she's been playing with this first batch for about a month now. Happy doggy - happy me!

customer_reviews.title: Not just for tennis.

customer_reviews.title: Great for keychain
customer_reviews.text: I run a flight school. We don't want students, instructors, renters or mechanics putting the aircraft keys in their pocket and taking them home or losing them. I attach a tennis ball to the aircraft key as part of the keychain. It's light enough to hang there while the plane is being flown or operated, but too bulky to forget you have it in your pocket. Before you call me a genius, I must confess that I copied this from the Cochise College Aviation Department, where I learned to fly many years ago. No, I don't like tennis.

product_meta.title: Penn Championship High Altitude Tennis Balls - Extra Duty Felt Pressurized Tennis Balls
product_meta.description:
About the Balls

Whether you're a seasoned veteran trying to perfect your game or a rookie learning the basics, Penn tennis balls are the number one choice. The best-selling tennis ball in America, Penn Championship is the standard by which all other tennis balls are measured. It features a controlled fiber release for perfectly even nap, natural rubber for consistent feel and reduced shock, and interlocked wool fiber for ultimate durability. The High Altitude Extra Duty felt is designed to perform best on hard courts, but can be effectively played in any setting with an elevation of at least 4000 feet. The Championship line provides unparalleled consistency every time you hit the court.

• Penn Championship is the Official Ball of USTA Leagues.

• Available in several quantity options up to 12 cans with 36 tennis balls total.

Penn

Penn celebrated 100 Years of Excellence in 2010. Starting in a small town in Jeanette, Pennsylvania in 1910, Penn is still America’s #1 One Selling Tennis Ball. Also, a purveyor of everything tennis, we put our 100+ years of expertise into all our tennis equipment & apparel so you can perform at the highest level every time you step on the court.
feature_bullets: AMERICA'S #1 SELLING BALL: The product of 100 years worth of testing and perfecting; Penn Championship is the best selling tennis ball in America.

PENN PERFORMANCE: Controlled fiber release provides perfectly even nap, while natural rubber offers consistent feel and reduced shock. The Championship line provides unparalleled consistency every time you hit the court.

ALL HIGH ALTITUDE COURTS: Extra duty tennis balls can be played on hard court matches and on indoor and outdoor softer, clay court surfaces as well. Please note that Penn high altitude tennis balls are intended for elevations of at least 4000'.

OFFICIAL BALL: Penn Championship is the Official Ball of USTA Leagues, so you know you're playing with high quality and consistent ball. Available in extra-duty felt, regular duty felt, or extra-duty high altitude felt. USTA and ITF approved.
LASTING DURABILITY: Interlocked wool fiber ensures the all courts tennis balls will play like new for as long as possible.
